intro: Marila parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered marila, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Marila parviflora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
